title: Representing SHM - compare spring constants graphs

content.question: A block is attached to a horizontal spring with spring constant <math alttext="k sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and undergoes simple harmonic motion. Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> shows a graph of the position of the block as a function of time over a time interval. The same block is then attached to a different horizontal spring, which has spring constant <math alttext="k sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and is again set into simple harmonic motion as represented by the position-time graph in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="k sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="k sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="k sub 2 is less than k sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, because the period in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is greater than that in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.
